snippet: The companies filed documents in support of the plan, which has faced opposition and will be the subject of a Senate hearing this week.
abstract: Comcast presents regulators with 650 pages of reasons to approve its takeover of Time Warner Cable, saying merger would spur rather than inhibit competition by encouraging rivals to improve their cable and high-speed Internet offerings; proposal, which has faced opposition, will be subject of upcoming Senate hearing.

byline.original: By EDWARD WYATT and ERIC LIPTON

lead_paragraph: The companies filed documents in support of the plan, which has faced opposition and will be the subject of a Senate hearing this week.

headline.main: Comcast Gears Up to Persuade Regulators
headline.print_headline: Comcast Gears Up to Persuade Regulators
